column2: Variant names ("?" in this column marks names that may refer to this person or someone else)
column8: Biographical notes

column7: Do not confuse with her daughter Esther Hunt (1783-1808); her sister-in-law (1752-1786) Esther Hunt Hooton; or her sister-in-law Esther Roberts Hunt Collins (1751-1820, w6gj3q0h in this document).
column8: Wife of John Hunt

column2: Joshua Evan, I. Evans? J. Ev? J. Evans?
column8: Son of Thomas Evans and Rebecca Owen. Married Priscilla Collins. Father of Rachel Evans, who married Abraham Warrington.

column7: His father was also named William Rogers, as was one of his sons
column8: Brother-in-law of JH. Son of William and Ann Rogers. Married Sarah Warrington in 1754. After she died, married again in 1767, this time to widow Grace Eayre née Allen (1741-10-06 - 1804-09-24)
Born in England. Married Ruth Whitson. Recognized as a minister c. 1764. Ruth died in 1803, and he remarried Ann Ingham. Moved to Ohio in 1809. Father of James Simpson

Son of Francis Collins. Married Ruth Burdil (1750-04-16 to 1805-10-05). After her death married Esther Hunt (née Roberts), widow of JH’s brother Joshua Hunt. Minister & elder of Chester Monthly Meeting.

column2: Robert Wilis, Robert Wills, R. Willis?
column8: Son of William and Hannah Willis. Traveled in Europe roughly 1770-1774
Brother of JH's wife Esther Warrington. Married Rebecca Walton (1733-1812).

column2: A. Wills, Aaron Willis, Aaron Wilis
column8: Son of Daniel Wills. Married Rachel Warrington (sister of JH's wife Esther Warrington) end of 1758 or start of 1759.

column2: Joshua Lipincott, I. Lippincott? J. Lippincott?
column8: Son of Freedom Lippincott and Elizabeth Wills. Married Rachel Dudley (1736-1795), daughter of Francis & Rachel. Elder of Upper Evesham Preparative Meeting.

Quaker minister born to Joshua & Naomi Ballinger. Married John Mason, 1773 (d. 1777); had 2 children w/ him. Remarried to widower Job Collins, son of Francis & Ann, on 1778-05-14 & had 10 children w/ him. Died 1831-01-02.

column7: Lots of people named children after William Penn, so make sure you're not looking at a copy-cat
column8: Prominent early Quaker and founder of Pennsylvania.
JH first met Jordan in 1800 (Journal, p. xi)

Born c. 1754 to John & Abigail Cox. Married Hannah Smith (d.1783), daut. of John Smith & Hannah Logan. Remarried Ann Dillwin of Philadelphia. Lived at "Oxmead" near Burlington NJ. Father of Susannah Cox Parrish; father-in-law of Joseph Parrish (1779-1840)

column2: John Reeve, John Reve, John Reves, J. Reeves?
column8: Son of Joseph and Eleanor Reeve. Married Jane Herves, widow of Aaron Herves. From Woodbury?

column2: B. Swett, Ben Swett, Benjamin Sweet
column8: Quaker minister from Haddonfield, N.J. Married Mary Howell of Phila. in 1762.

column2: Esther Roberts? E. Collins? Esther Hunt?
column7: Do not confuse with John Hunt's wife Esther (w6wx87x7 in this document) or the other Esther Hunts described in her entry.
column8: Born Esther Roberts, daut. of Enoch & Rachel. Married Joshua Hunt (brother of JH) 1778 in Moorestown. Moved to Redstone in Fayette County, Pa., in 1790. Joshua died a few years later. Remarried John Collins in 1807 & returned to NJ.
Wife of Benjamin Swett. Born Mary Howell.
Quaker minister who traveled extensively in North America and Britain. From Burlington, N.J.

column7: Be careful not to confuse with his son
column8: Quaker minister from Burlington County, N.J. Died in December 1775.

column7: Be careful not to confuse with his father, who died in 1775
column8: Son of the other Isaac Andrews. John Hunt visited him a number of times to encourage him to follow Quaker doctrine more closely.
Quaker minister from Mount Holly, NJ
